title: 105_hr1248
content: The "Rural Health Care Protection Act of 1997" may be cited as the official title. It classifies as rural referral centers. The "Rural Health Care Protection Act of 1997" prohibits denial of reclassification requests based on wage comparability for hospitals classified as rural referral centers. The Social Security Act allows hospitals to request a change in classification for the area wage index under certain conditions. The Social Security Act allows hospitals to request a change in classification for the area wage index. Proportional adjustments in Medicare payment amounts for inpatient hospital services are made to prevent increases in aggregate payments. Previously designated rural referral centers will maintain their classification for subsequent fiscal years. Budget neutrality provisions apply to reclassifications. The Social Security Act allows hospitals to request a change in classification for the area wage index, with proportional adjustments in Medicare payment amounts for inpatient hospital services to prevent payment increases. Reclassifications made pursuant to paragraph (1) are applied in the same manner as reclassifications under section 1886(d)(10) of the Act. The Social Security Act permits hospital geographic reclassification for disproportionate share payment adjustments. The Social Security Act is amended to allow hospitals to apply for additional payment amounts under certain conditions. A hospital can request geographic reclassification for payment adjustments within 60 days of the Act's enactment. The Act allows hospitals to request a change in classification for disproportionate share hospital payments. The Board will apply guidelines for reclassification until separate guidelines are established by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must adjust medicare payment amounts for inpatient hospital services to prevent increased payments due to geographic reclassifications. SEC. 4. Permitting rebasing of payment for sole community hospitals using fiscal years 1994 and 1995 costs. Section 1886(b)(3) of the Social Security Act is amended to ensure that the target amount for a hospital for fiscal year 1998 is not less than the average allowable operating costs of inpatient hospital services recognized for a specific period, with compounded increases for subsequent fiscal years.
